text:
On a hot July evening, a young man stepped from his garret. 

He hesitated, glancing toward K. bridge. 

He avoided his landlady on the stairs. 

Her kitchen door stood open, always. 

His stomach knotted with fear. 

He owed her money. 

He scowled, ashamed. 

“I can’t face her,” he thought. 

He wasn't cowardly. 

He felt trapped in his own mind. 

Isolation gripped him tightly. 

Poverty crushed him, but he felt numb. 

He had stopped caring about everything. 

He took a deep breath and stepped into the night.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A young man, burdened by debt and isolation, hesitates to leave his cramped garret due to his fear of encountering his landlady.
